de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Class DataMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.DataMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink

    class DataMapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkDataSink
    This class is designed to forward data to NetworkDataSinks.

    It supports mapping them from (SensorType, NetworkDevice) tuples or from SensorType to NetworkDataSink.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  DataMapper.SinkOriginFilter
      This is a small NetworkDataSink that only forwards data from one origin if the SinkOriginFilter#SinkOriginFilter(NetworkDataSink, NetworkDevice) constructor is used, or all data if the NetworkDevice parameter is null.

    • Field Detail

      • mConnectionHandler

        private ClientConnectionManager mConnectionHandler
        This class is used for keeping the sensor-, button and speed requirements synchronous

      • mDataSinks

        private java.util.EnumMap<SensorType,java.util.HashSet<DataMapper.SinkOriginFilter>> mDataSinks
        Stores all known data sinks. Since they are mapped to their sensor, this also stores the currently required sensors as its keyset.

        This variable is an EnumMap, so iterations over the keys should be quite fast. The sinks are stored in a HashSet for each sensor, so no sink can occur twice for one sensor type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • setConnectionHandler

        void setConnectionHandler(ClientConnectionManager connectionHandler)
        Set the ClientConnectionManager notified of potentially required sensor requirement changes
        Parameters:
        connectionHandler - the ClientConnectionManager notified of potentially required sensor requirement changes

      • registerDataSink

        void registerDataSink(SensorType sensorType,
                      @Nullable
                      NetworkDevice dataOrigin,
                      NetworkDataSink dataSink)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Register a new data sink to be included in the data stream. Only data from a single client and sensor will arrive.
        Parameters:
        dataSink - where new data from the sensor should go
        dataOrigin - the network device which is allowed to send to this sink, or null, if any devices data shall be accepted
        sensorType - which sensor should be activated, and reach the given NetworkDataSink
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the sensor change

      • registerDataSink

        void registerDataSink(SensorType sensorType,
                      NetworkDataSink dataSink)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Register a new data sink to be included in the data stream. Only data from a single sensor will arrive.
        Parameters:
        dataSink - where new data from the sensor should go
        sensorType - which sensor should be activated, and reach the given NetworkDataSink
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the sensor change

      • onClientRemoved

        void onClientRemoved(NetworkDevice client)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Called to notify of the loss of a client. That client will be removed from internal lists.
        Parameters:
        client - the lost client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if another client could not be notified of changed sensor requirements

      • unregisterDataSink

        void unregisterDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Removes a NetworkDataSink from this data mapper, so that it no longer receives data
        Parameters:
        dataSink - the data sink that should no longer be used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if another client could not be notified of changed sensor requirements

      • unregisterDataSink

        void unregisterDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                        SensorType sensor)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Unregister a data sink from a single sensor
        Parameters:
        dataSink - which data sink to remove
        sensor - the sensor for which the data sink was registered
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeIf

        private void removeIf(java.util.function.Predicate<DataMapper.SinkOriginFilter> predicate,
                      @Nullable
                      SensorType sensor)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Remove all SinkOriginFilters where the given lambda returns true.
        Parameters:
        sensor - a SensorType if only sinks registered for that type should be removed, or null, if all sinks where the predicate returns true should be removed
        predicate - returns true for all SinkOriginFilters that should be removed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of updated sensor requirements

      • onData

        public void onData(NetworkDevice origin,
                   SensorData data,
                   float userSensitivity)
        onData is called whenever new data is to be processed. here, we forwardData the data to
        Specified by:
        onData in interface NetworkDataSink
        Parameters:
        origin - the network device which sent the data
        data - the sensor data
        userSensitivity - the sensitivity the user requested in his app settings

      • close

        public void close()
        called when the sink is no longer used and should no longer require resources. no commands required here
        Specified by:
